text: Perhaps they should call it the Can't Film Festival this year. As the legendary cinema competition opened today on the French Riviera, there are some new rules that celebrities, attendees and studios will have to follow. First among them — quelle horreur! — selfies are no longer allowed on the red carpet. But given how many paparazzi descend on the Croisette each year, getting a photo to prove you attended, shouldn't be that hard to come by. Next, there will be no press screenings in advance of the premieres, a change that could actually be an improvement as critics will not be able to influence negative opinions of films until an actual audience has seen it.
